items.text: To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, Michtam of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, Michtam of David.

items.text: Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?
items.plainText: Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?

items.text: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.
items.plainText: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.

items.text: The wicked are estranged from the womb: they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.
items.plainText: The wicked are estranged from the womb: they go astray as soon as they be born, speaking lies.

items.text: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;
items.plainText: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;

items.text: Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.
items.plainText: Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.

items.text: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O LORD.
items.plainText: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O LORD.

items.text: Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.
items.plainText: Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.

items.text: As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.
items.plainText: As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.

items.text: Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.
items.plainText: Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.

items.text: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
items.plainText: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

items.text: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.
items.plainText: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.
